newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton output reaches 8.250 mln bales.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton output reaches 8.250 mln bales.

text.p: Pakistan's state cotton organisation said on Saturday output had reached a provisional 8.25 million 375-lb bales by February 13 in the 1996/97 (July-June) crop year, down from 9.433 million bales in the year-ago period.

The Cotton Export Corporation said mills had purchased 6.408 million bales, down from 6.930 million in the year-ago period, while exporters had bought only 3,900 bales, against 1.110 million bales last year.
Ginning factories held unsold stocks of 1.838 million bales compared to 1.392 million bales a year earlier.

Officials believe 1996/97 cotton production will not exceed nine million bales due to pest damage in recent months in the Punjab province cotton belt. Early forecasts put the crop at 10 million bales. Pakistan produced 9.96 million bales in 1995/96.
